meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be avoided or escaped.
meanings.sent1: The storm ineluctably approached, forcing everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: She knew that the deadline was ineluctably approaching, so she worked diligently to finish on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat ineluctably chased the laser pointer, unaware of the trickery at play.
meanings.sent4: Time moves ineluctably forward, never pausing for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of hunger grew ineluctably stronger as the day went on.

meanings.definition: In a way that is inevitable.
meanings.sent1: As the sun set, darkness ineluctably spread across the sky.
meanings.sent2: Change is ineluctably part of life, no matter how much we resist it.
meanings.sent3: The toddler ineluctably made a mess while trying to feed themselves spaghetti.
meanings.sent4: The truth ineluctably emerged, revealing the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: Laughter ineluctably followed the comedian's jokes, filling the room with joy.
